availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alfred S. Ogilvie (Williamson County, Tennessee, farmer. )

body.p: Williamson County, Tennessee, farmer. Tennessee native. Married to Mira M. Riggs Ogilvie in Williamson County, Tennessee, on May 4, 1836. Father of Mary Francis Ogilvie, Overton S. Ogilvie, Valerie A. Ogilvie, Sarah K. Ogilvie, Rufus R. Ogilvie, and Alice Ogilvie. Resident of Williamson County, Tennessee, in 1840. Owned four enslaved persons in Williamson County in 1840. Farmer in Williamson County in 1850. Owned twelve enslaved persons in Williamson County in 1850. Farmer in Williamson County in 1860. Owned thirty-one enslaved persons in Williamson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN, Williamson County, 1830-1839: Marriages, (Loose) Jo-Pr.
"Tennessee Items," The Memphis Argus (Memphis, TN), September 27, 1865, p. 1.
